effect: Seals in moisture and protects skin

side_effect: Octinoxate, oxybenzone, and homosalate are possible endocrine disruptors and may contribute to skin cancer
verdict: Bad if contains octinoxate, oxybenzone, or homosalate

effect: Lightens dark spots and evens skin tone.
side_effect: May cause dryness or irritation if overused.
verdict: Good if used in recommended concentrations. Potentially Bad if causes irritation.
usage_notes: Use 1-2% in serums. Apply once daily.

effect: Acts as surfactants for lathering purposes.
side_effect: Can irritate eyes and skin. Potentially toxic for aquatic species.
verdict: Potentially Bad if causing irritation or environmental harm

effect: Used to keep skincare and makeup fresh and germ-free.
side_effect: Causes increased production of the hormone estrogen (female sex hormone) and interferes with reproductive and brain function. Can lead to breast cancer.
verdict: Bad if causing hormonal imbalances or breast cancer

effect: Used for the spreadability of a product.
verdict: Bad if causing reproductive or developmental issues

effect: Derived from petroleum or coal tar.
side_effect: Can cause skin irritations, cancers, acne breakouts and ADHD (attention deficit hyperactivity disorder).
verdict: Bad if causing skin irritations, cancers, or ADHD

effect: Found in skincare products like perfumes, moisturizers, shampoos, cleansers and conditioners.
side_effect: Associated with respiratory disorders, skin allergies, dermatitis, and side effects in the reproductive system. Potential carcinogens (cancer-causing agents), irritants and endocrine disruptors.
verdict: Bad if causing respiratory disorders, skin allergies, dermatitis, or reproductive issues

effect: A common chemical found in tubes of toothpaste, antibacterial soaps and deodorants.
side_effect: Endocrine disruptor and a skin irritant. Can lead to gut inflammation and tumor growth in mammals.
verdict: Bad if causing endocrine disruption or tumor growth

side_effect: Can cause skin irritations, cancers, acne breakouts and ADHD (attention deficit hyperactivity disorder). Potentially toxic for aquatic species.
verdict: Bad if causing skin irritations, cancers, or ADHD
